article.headline: Biden campaign pulls down attack ads as Trump departs White House for hospital
article.body: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden boards his plane at Gerald Ford Airport after campaigning Friday in Grand Rapids, Mich. Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images Joe Biden’s campaign is taking down its attack ads — also known as negative or contrast advertising — in the wake of President Donald Trump’s coronavirus infection. That’s according to a Biden campaign official who spoke on the condition of anonymity on Friday to discuss internal planning. The Democrat’s campaign is removing all its negative ads, although in some cases it may take days for ads already in circulation to stop running. The official said Biden made the decision before news surfaced that Trump was being transferred to a military hospital for a “few days” of treatment. The Trump re-election campaign said several hours later that it would not reciprocate and pause advertisements attacking Biden, CNN reported. iframe.twitter-tweet { width: 100% !important; } The presidential election is just over one month away. MarketWatch contributed.
